newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: CORONATION LAUNCHES ESKOM BOND UNIT TRUST.
newsitem.headline: CORONATION LAUNCHES ESKOM BOND UNIT TRUST.

text.p: Coronation Holdings Ltd and electricity utility Eskom said on Wednesday they had entered an alliance to launch a bond unit trust specialising in Eskom securities.
The new unit trust, the Coronation Specialist Bond Fund, would be 80 percent invested in Eskom securities and the remaining in government securities.

Eskom Treasury general manager Johan van den Berg said the alliance with Coronation established a new funding vehicle for Eskom as it would enable it to tap into investors who would now be able to invest relatively small amounts in Eskom bonds.
"The unit trust mechanism is ideally suited to handle this type of high-volume, small transaction business," he said.
Eskom bonds valued at 23.5 billion rand are currently held by over 15,000 private investors.
The new unit trust would offer these investors favourable terms to switch their direct investments in Eskom bonds to indirect holdings through the fund.
The fund would also offer investors a guaranteed eight percent income distribution per year.
